article_text: Hospitals that treat California’s poorest patients are faring badly under the Affordable Care Act’s drive to improve quality. Under ACA authority, Medicare is imposing fines on safety-net hospitals at twice the rate paid by other hospitals, according to an analysis by the Center for Health Reporting.

article_metadata.title: Turlock’s Emanuel, other safety-net hospitals struggle under Affordable Care Act | The Modesto Bee

article_summary:
Hospitals that treat California’s poorest patients are faring badly under the Affordable Care Act’s drive to improve quality.
Under ACA authority, Medicare is imposing fines on safety-net hospitals at twice the rate paid by other hospitals, according to an analysis by the Center for Health Reporting.
